meanings.definition: A place where goods are kept for sale.
meanings.sent1: The small store on the corner sells snacks and drinks.
meanings.sent2: I need to stop by the store to pick up some groceries.
meanings.sent3: Why did the store run out of ice cream on the hottest day of the year?
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a store of memories, each one carefully preserved.
meanings.sent5: The store was filled with the aroma of freshly baked bread.

meanings.definition: To keep or accumulate for future use.
meanings.sent1: I store my old toys in the attic for safekeeping.
meanings.sent2: She likes to store extra blankets in the closet for winter.
meanings.sent3: He tried to store all the information in his brain, but it kept slipping away.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel would store nuts in the hollow of the tree for the winter.
meanings.sent5: The farmer would store his harvest in the barn to sell later.

meanings.definition: A supply or stock of something.
meanings.sent1: The store of firewood was running low as winter approached.
meanings.sent2: She had a store of patience that seemed endless.
meanings.sent3: The store of jokes he had was enough to make anyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His store of knowledge on the subject was impressive.
meanings.sent5: The store of energy she had seemed to never diminish.
